Clint Hurtt returns for U of L Senior Day

Former assistant on hand to honor Mauldin

Clint Hurtt returns for U of L Senior Day

Steve Jones, swjones1@courier-journal.com 2:48 p.m. EST November 29, 2014

CONNECT 8 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Former U of L defensive line coach Clint Hurtt made his return to Papa John's Cardinal Stadium as part of the Senior Day receiving party for defensive end Lorenzo Mauldin.

Hurtt, now the assistant defensive line coach at U of L, was part of Charlie Strong's staff from 2010-14. Hurtt, who faced an NCAA show-cause penalty for violations committed while on the staff at Miami, was held over onto Bobby Petrino's staff after Strong left for Texas, but Hurtt departed for the Bears a few weeks after Petrino was hired.

Mauldin was among 23 U of L players honored on Senior Day.

The others: offensive lineman Chris Acosta, running back Dominique Brown, fullback Luke Brohm, offensive lineman Jamon Brown, tight end Gerald Christian, wide receiver Kai De La Cruz, long snapper Grant Donovan, defensive tackle B.J. Dubose, running back Michael Dyer, cornerback Terell Floyd, wide receiver Michaelee Harris, cornerback Andrew Johnson, punter Ryan Johnson, offensive lineman John Miller, wide receiver Matt Milton, linebacker Deiontrez Mount, quarterback Brett Nelson, offensive lineman David Noltemeyer, wide receiver DeVante Parker, defensive lineman Andrew Polston, wide receiver Eli Rogers and offensive lineman Jake Smith.

Entering Saturday game, U of L's seniors had gone 38-12 over four years, including four bowl appearances.
